prompt: <description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The model has a hollow center and is slightly tilted to the right. Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Step 2: Draw the first face of the prism 1. Draw a rectangle with the following points: * [0.0, 0.0] * [0.75, 0.0] * [0.75, 0.3462] * [0.0, 0.3462] Step 3: Draw the second face of the prism 1. Draw a smaller rectangle inside the first rectangle with the following points: * [0.0216, 0.0144] * [0.3678, 0.0144] * [0.3678, 0.3317] * [0.0216, 0.3317] Step 4: Draw the third face of the prism 1. Draw a larger rectangle outside the first rectangle with the following points: * [0.3822, 0.0144] * [0.7284, 0.0144] * [0.7284, 0.3317] * [0.3822, 0.3317] Step 5: Create a sketch plane for the curved side 1. Create a sketch plane perpendicular to the normal of the flat top face. Step 6: Draw the curved side of the prism 1. Draw a spline that connects the following points on the projected curve in the sketch plane: * [0.0216, 0.3317] * [0.3678, 0.3317] * [0.7284, 0.3317] * [0.3822, 0.0144] Step 7: Extrude the sketches to create the 3D prism 1. Extrude the flat top and bottom faces by 0.0288 units towards the positive Z-direction. 2. Extrude the curved side by 0.0288 units towards the positive Z-direction, creating a hollow center within the prism. Step 8: (Optional) Apply euler angles to tilt the model slightly to the right (Note: This step may vary depending on the specific CAD software used) 1. Apply the euler angles to the model, tilting it slightly to the right.</description>
